Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Intraoperative Cerebral Desaturation on Postoperative Outcomes in Non-Cardiac Surgery

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the non-cardiac surgical procedures that provoke a reduction in rScO2 and evaluate whether an intraoperative reduction in rScO2 influences postoperative outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the occurrence of postoperative cognitive dysfunction (POCD) related to intraoperative cerebral desaturation.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Evidence suggests that rScO2 is reduced during thoracic surgery involving single lung ventilation, major abdominal surgery, hip surgery, and laparoscopic surgery with the patient in anti-Trendelenburg's position.
